comment.author: 18753752@N00
comment._content: Found this article after I Googled Frank Gould: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9506E3D91539E13AB... That's the first Mrs. Gould and the girls names are Helen & Dorothy.

comment.author: 30085166@N00
comment._content: Mrs. Frank Gould was the former Helen Margaret Kelly, daughter of Edward Kelly and granddaughter of banker Eugene Kelly. She was 18 years old when she married Frank Gould, youngest son of financier Jay Gould, on December 2nd, 1901. The wedding was reported in the New York Times the following day. They divorced in 1908, and the terms of the settlement were described in this New York Times article from May 11, 1909. Though Frank Gould was granted custody of his daughters for the greater part of each year, young Helen and Dorothy ended up spending most of that time with their aunt, Helen Gould, who became Mrs. Finley J. Shepard in 1913 (Times article.) The former Mrs. Frank Gould married twice more (that I can find), in 1910, to Ralph Thomas (d.1914), and in 1917 to Prince Houreddin (or Noureddin) Vlora of Albania, from whom she was divorced in 1922 (brief Times Article.) Daughters Helen and Dorothy both went on to marry Swiss Barons, and then divorce them according to a brief item in Time Magazine on February 18th, 1935. I've been unable to find what became of Helen after her divorce, but Dorothy was married again, to Basil Frederick Boothby, which got her cited in Burke's Peerage. She died in 1990.

comment.author: 83025347@N00
comment._content: There is another photo of the kids here: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3084403295/

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Dorothy Gould Burns (1904-1969) died in 1969. Her second, and last husband was Archibald Burns, a Mexican national of Scottish parents. I don't know where the incorrect information from "The Peerage" came from, but it is incorrect. I will add a short biography of her to Wikipedia. Source: ftp.resource.org/courts.gov/c/F2/532/532.F2d.809.75-6062....

comment.author: 70256663@N03
comment._content:
Correction: Helen & Dorothy were not twins.  Helen was born  Sept 19, 1902 on the yacht Helenita at anchor in Oyster Bay, Long Island, NY.  Dorothy was born at home 834 Fifth Ave, NYC.  Source: The News-Democrat, Oct 9, 1906 (free access via Google News Archive).

Also, the spelling of her maiden name varies -- some news accounts use Kelly others Kelley.  An account of her grandfather's great accomplishments uses both spellings in the same article.  See (free via Google News Archive)  Lewiston Evening Journal, Dec 19, 1894 – Death of Eugene Kelley, a well known Irish-American and His Busy and Worthy Life.
